words and phrases to english.gripping: exciting or interesting in a way that keeps your attention
words and phrases to english.remarkable [rɪˈmɑːkəbl]: unusual or surprising in a way that causes people to take notice
words and phrases to english.genuinely [dʒenjuɪnli]: truly; in a way that is exactly what it appears to be and is not artificial
words and phrases to english.liability [ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti]: the state of being legally responsible for something
words and phrases to english.unprecedented: that has never happened, been done or been known before
words and phrases to english.exploit [ɪkˈsplɔɪt]: to treat a person or situation as an opportunity to gain an advantage for yourself
words and phrases to english.scrupulous [ˈskruːpjələs]: careful about paying attention to every detail
words and phrases to english.zeitgeist [ˈzaɪtɡaɪst]: the general mood or quality of a particular period of history, as shown by the ideas, beliefs, etc. common at the time
words and phrases to english.welfare [ˈwelfeə(r)]: the general health, happiness and safety of a person, an animal or a group
words and phrases to english.cyclical [ˈsaɪklɪkal]: repeated many times and always happening in the same order
words and phrases to english.impose [ɪmˈpəʊz]: to introduce a new law, rule, tax, etc.
words and phrases to english.blatant [ˈbleɪtnt]: (of actions that are considered bad) done in an obvious and open way without caring if people are shocked
words and phrases to english.Modest [ˈmɒdɪst]: not very large, expensive, important, etc.
words and phrases to english.Carnival [ˈkɑːnɪvl]: a public festival, usually one that happens at a regular time each year, that involves music and dancing in the streets, for which people wear brightly coloured clothes
words and phrases to english.ceiling [ˈsiːlɪŋ]: the top inside surface of a room
words and phrases to english.vary [ˈveəri]: to be different from each other in size, shape, etc.
words and phrases to english.wafer [ˈweɪfə(r)]: a thin, light biscuit, often eaten with ice cream
words and phrases to english.dough: a mixture of flour, water, etc. that is made into bread and pastry
words and phrases to english.festival: a day or period of the year when people stop working to celebrate a special event, often a religious one OR a series of performances of music, plays, films, etc., usually organized in the same place once a year
words and phrases to english.Outburst [ˈaʊtbɜːst/]: a sudden strong expression of an emotion
words and phrases to english.prevalent [ˈprevələnt]: dominant, common | that exists or is very common at a particular time or in a particular place
words and phrases to english.refugee: a person who has been forced to leave their country or home, because there is a war or for political, religious or social reasons
words and phrases to english.authority: the power to give orders to people
words and phrases to english.minority: the smaller part of a group
words and phrases to english.majority: the bigger part of a group
